item.title: Open Source Planning for Tractus-X
item.description: The Eclipse Tractus-X Open Planning Days - Empowering the Catena-X Data Space
item.content:encoded:
Hello Open Source Enthusiasts! üéâ

the Catena-X open-source reference implementations are currently mainly driven by the Catena-X consortium. We want to open-up the software development step by step and therefore warmly invite you to shape and contribute to this reference implementation!

To get more transparency about the status and product roadmaps of our reference implementations, we will conduct refinement and planning meetings in the Tractus-X open-source community.

We're thrilled to announce our upcoming planning sessions for Tractus-X:

  • Open Refinementsession on 19.10.2023
  • Open Planning/Review Session on 25.10.2023

Here's your chance to be part of an exciting journey from the ground up.

Disclaimer‚Äã

In the current Catena-X consortium, the various product teams have significantly shaped and defined the Catena-X data space including business use cases, network services, and the architecture and have released tangible results such as standards, KITs and open-source reference implementations. The results are now to be handed over to the Catena-X association.

With the transition to an association, a new working model including (open) refinement and (open) plannings for PI11 must be implemented in order to further develop these results and to carry out the knowledge transfer step by step by joint teams consisting of new association members and experienced consortium members under the governance of the Catena-X association.

The open planning days are the first step in this direction, but not all products are ready right now for an open planning. It might be the case, that some of the features are still defined within the jira, which is provided by the consortia. In this case not all of the participants can access the features with jira.

Please note In case there is a need to update an issue (e.g. adapt the description or link a subissue as a tasklist) committer rights are needed, or the initial creator of the issue has to do the changes.

These first alignment sessions will not be an introductory session - you should already be familiar with the source code of the service. We will introduce other formats to make sure you get onboarded and your voice is heard if you are new. We appreciate your understanding! Our committers would highly appreciate contributions as a continuous stream of smaller, more manageable changes, rather than a big all-is-done chunk at the end of development. Thank you!

Why Should You Attend?‚Äã

  • Share your planned contributions and discuss them openly with contributers, fellow developers and reference solution product owners.
  • Collaborate with fellow developers and tech enthusiasts.
  • Inform yourself about the latest developments in the open-source community.
  • Share your expertise and insights to shape the future of Tractus-X.
  • Learn about the core objectives and see how you can contribute.
  • Connect with the Tractus-X community and build your network.

Some links to get you started‚Äã

  • Getting started with Eclipse Tractus-X
  • Eclipse Tractus-X GitHub getting started
  • Planning with the sig-release repositorry
  • Feature planning board (without product filter)
  • Current available labels
  • Matrix Chat from Eclipse Tractus-X and getting-started
  • sig-release planning board and created features on sig-release repository

Open Refinement Session on 19.10.2023‚Äã

Join us for our Open Refinement Session, where we'll embark on a high-level exploration of our project's features and outstanding issues. This session offers a platform for developers, stakeholders, and enthusiasts to come together and clarify project requirements in dediacted breakoutsessions. It's an opportunity to ask questions and ensure everyone has a shared understanding of the project's direction.

By participating, you'll not only contribute to a smoother development process but also help in shaping the project's roadmap.

Be aware to refine your features within the sig-release repository ( on a high level until 17.10.2023 EOB ) and the related subtasks/issues in your product repository.

Introduction and Overview‚Äã

‚è∞ 09:00 AM - 09:30 AM

  • Sessionlink
  • Welcome note by the consortia PMs and Tractus-X Team Lead.
  • Brief overview of Tractus-X's mission and vision.

Breakoutsessions‚Äã

‚è∞ 09:30 AM - 12:30 PM

Team/TopicPresenterConsortium representativeIssuesSessionlink
Portal & Marketplacesall contributerJulia Jeroch[Issues]Sessionlink
Tractus-X EDCall contributerStefan Ettl[Issues]Sessionlink
Managed Identity Walletall contributerOliver Schlienz[Issues]Sessionlink
IRSall contributerJohannes Zahn[Issues]Sessionlink
BPN & Discovery Finderall contributerThomas Henn[Issues]Sessionlink
Knowledge Agentall contributerTom Buchert[Issues]Sessionlink
BPDM and Country Riskall contributerBenjamin Renn / Philipp Butzmann[Issues]Sessionlink

Concluding Remarks and Open Floor‚Äã

‚è∞ 12:30 PM - 01:00 PM

  • Sessionlink
  • Recap of all products and key takeaways
  • Community Q&A
  • Closing note and the next steps for Tractus-X

Open Planning/Review Session on 25.10.2023‚Äã

Join us for our Open Planning Session, where we would like to focus on the features which have been planned / committed for the next release.

We'll collaboratively prioritize features, set clear milestones, and match tasks with the right talents and teams. More than just an organizational meeting, this is a space for dialogue, a chance for all contributors to weigh in on our strategic approach.

Whether you're a core developer, a stakeholder, or someone passionate about our mission, your insights are vital to make informed decisions. Let's shape our vision into a structured, actionable plan together!

Introduction and Vision‚Äã

‚è∞ 9:30 AM - 10:30 AM

  • Sessionlink
  • Welcome note by the consortia PMs and Tractus-X Team Lead.
  • Brief overview of Tractus-X's mission and vision.

Review/Planning Sessions‚Äã

‚è∞ 10:30 AM - 05:15 PM

  • Sessionlink
TimelineTeam/TopicPresenterConsortium representativeIssues
10:30 AM - 11:15 AMPortal & Marketplacesall contributerJulia Jeroch[Issues]

04:15 PM - 04:30 PMShort Break---

Concluding Remarks and Open Floor‚Äã

‚è∞ 05:15 PM - 05:45 PM

  • Sessionlink
  • Recap of all products and key takeaways
  • Community Q&A
  • Closing note and the next steps for Tractus-X

Stay Connected‚Äã

Follow our news section and join our Tractus-X mailing list and be part of our Matrix Chat from Eclipse Tractus-X

For more details about Tractus-X, visit the official Eclipse Tractus-X Project Page.

Looking forward to planning, coding, and succeeding together!

üöÄ The Tractus-X Team
item.author: stephan.bauer@catena-x.net (Stephan Bauer)

item.title: First Eclipse Tractus-X Community Days
item.description: The Eclipse Tractus-X Community Days - Empowering the Catena-X Data Space
item.content:encoded:
Dear Tractus-X-Community, dear All, being interested in Catena-X and the open source reference implementations, KITs and open core products in the Tractus-X project or in general in the technology of data sovereign data exchange,

We are pleased to announce the First Eclipse Tractus-X Community Days, which will take place on December 7th and 8th at ARENA2036 in Stuttgart.

Worth being there‚Äã

At this networking and coding event at ARENA2036, we offer you the opportunity to come together live with the developer community and actively code with our Tractus-X IT tools (KITs) for the Eclipse Tractus-X project and exchange ideas with our technical experts. Gain deep insights into the Catena-X architecture and actively contribute your ideas to practical participation opportunities (use cases, KITs, services).

What awaits you‚Äã

The agenda includes short keynote speeches with highly interesting technical insights, deep dives for a practical introduction to open-source programming topics and IT tools (our Open-Source Tractus-X KITs) and, above all, workshops in which you can become active and code yourself. You can bring your own challenges (please coordinate with us beforehand). At the evening event on the first day you can network, talk shop, code until late into the night - and of course just have fun.

Who meets here‚Äã

  • Developers who use Tractus-X or want to participate.
  • Service or solution providers who want to participate in the Catena-X ecosystem.
  • Data providers who want to provide data in the right format and with the right semantics.
  • Those responsible for the planning and development of products (product owners or product managers) who want to learn how projects are planned in open source.

You belong to one of the above, then you are exactly right here. With the support of experts and in exchange with like-minded people, you can actively test the possibilities of Tractus-X and the Catena-X KITs. But of course, other technology-loving participants with an interest in sovereign data exchange are also welcomed.

How you can participate‚Äã

If you would like to join, please register for free via Eventbrite: Tractus-X Community Days registration. The number of places is limited, so it is worth being quick!

Contact‚Äã

If you have any questions about the event, please contact heike.wohlfeld@arena2036.de.

Get to know the developer community live and network with like-minded people - we look forward to your creativity and contributions! Your Tractus-X Team

Presenters of the event‚Äã

This is an Eclipse Tractus-X event, which takes place within the framework of the Catena-X Automotive Network consortium project (funding code: 13IK004*) and the Catena-X Automotive Network e.V.. ARENA2036 will host the event on its premises and contribute its data space activities (ARENA-X).
item.author: daniel.miehle@bmw.de (Daniel Miehle)

item.title: Tractus-X 23.09 available now
item.content:encoded:
We are pleased to announce the Tractus-X Release 23.09! This release brings important improvements to our Catena-X operating system and KITs in terms of robustness, data sovereignty, compliance, and overall user experience for all data space participants.

Catena-X Operating System (cxOS):‚Äã

We are introducing a decentralized registry for digital twins and a managed identity wallet based on self-sovereign identities to maximize sovereignty of all data space participants. In addition, we offer the first ever integration with a Gaia-X Digital Clearing House (GXDCH) to foster trust and data space interoperability.

Use Cases & Value Creation:‚Äã

With six new KITs, we are introducing exciting new offerings and standards for our solution providers and data providers to build a multi-vendor ecosystem of applications and services.

Data Space Governance:‚Äã

The Catena-X Automotive Network e.V. will introduce significant advancements in the governance framework for data space operations by providing the flight level model and new use case policies by end of the of the month.
item.author: daniel.miehle@bmw.de (Daniel Miehle)

item.title: Tractus-X 3.1 available now
item.content:encoded:
We are pleased to announce the release of Tractus-X 3.1! This release brings important improvements to the robustness, quality, and overall user experience of the Catena-X data space. In addition, we introduce exciting new offerings for our solution providers such as the Traceability KIT and the Country Risk Service.

With version 3.1, the Catena-X Association also introduces significant advancements in data sovereignty by providing the first version of the Governance Framework as well as Policies for our use case Traceability.
item.author: daniel.miehle@bmw.de (Daniel Miehle)

item.title: Eclipse Tractus-X Developer Portal is LIVE!
item.content:encoded:
We are thrilled to announce the launch of the Developer Portal for the Eclipse Tractus-X project! This portal is designed to provide developers with an easy way to access all of our resources and documentation.

With this new portal, we aim to make it easier than ever before for developers around the world to get started building amazing projects on top of the Catena-X network. We have included our initial KITs and developer guides that will help you develop your solution. Step by step we will also provide a comprehensive overview of useful reference material.

The best part? All these resources are free and open-source! So what‚Äôs stopping you from taking advantage right now? Let‚Äôs get coding together and build something amazing with Tractus-X today!
item.author: daniel.miehle@bmw.de (Daniel Miehle)
